faqQuestion: What are Permitted and Prohibited Items?
faqAnswer: Prohibited items are weapons, explosives, incendiaries, and items that are seemingly harmless but may be used as weapons - the so-called "dual-use" items.

faqQuestion: How can I get directions to the Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer: The most common landmark that passengers could ask for is Hebbal, which is a definite start point of your journey to reach Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru. From Hebbal, you will get on to the National Highway (NH) 7, which is the Bangalore-Hyderabad Highway.

faqQuestion: Are there any airport taxes charged at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ? What is UDF ?
faqAnswer: UDF stands for User Development Fee, which is charged to all our passengers towards the construction, management, and operation of the Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru. It is levied on embarking domestic and international passengers for the provision of passenger amenities, services, and facilities. The UDF is approved by the Ministry of Civil Aviation. At Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru, a UDF of Rs. 1537.08 is collected from all our international departure passengers and Rs. 384.27 from all our domestic departure passengers. UDF is applicable to greenfield airports like Bangalore where the airport has been built from scratch requiring large investments

faqQuestion: Where is Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai located ?
faqAnswer: Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai  operates domestic airlines - SpiceJet, IndiGo and GoAir from Terminal 1 located at Santacruz (E), Mumbai and the airlines Vistara, AirIndia and Jet Airways from Terminal 2 located at Sahar, Andheri (E), Mumbai. All the international operations are carried out from Terminal

faqQuestion: Where can one meet their guests post arrival in Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer: One can meet their guests arriving from international destinations in Mumbai at the Meeters and Greeters area located at arrivals on level 2 at T2. Guest arriving in Mumbai from domestic destinations can be met at the arrivals exit at T1.

faqQuestion: Where are the Money changer/Foreign Exchange counters located in Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
Terminal 2 - Money changer/Foreign Exchange counters are situated at departures (level 4), arrival (level 2) and Ground Transportation Lobby (level 1) at Terminal 2.
Terminal 1 - At Terminal 1, the counters are situated at the arrival and departure halls.

faqQuestion: How do I travel between terminals at Chennai International Airport ?
faqAnswer: Free battery-operated vehicles and courtesy coaches offering shuttle service for the convenience of transit passengers between Domestic & International terminals of Chennai International Airport .

faqQuestion: Is there any Airline Lounge facility at Chennai International Airport ?
faqAnswer: Lounges at multiple locations in the Domestic & International Departures of Chennai Airport offers world class amenities including best of cuisines, plush seating, complimentary Wi-Fi, wide range of National, International & Regional dailies along with various magazines. Serving round the clock the lounges cater to Airline CIP customers as well as passengers availing access through Priority Pass, high-end credit cards and other loyalty cards.

faqQuestion: Are there any Retiring rooms facility at Chennai International Airport ?
faqAnswer: Air Transit Passengers can avail the facilities of Retiring Rooms & Dormitories at Chennai International Airport , with a transit period of maximum 24hrs., on ‘first come first serve basis’. The facility cannot be booked in advance. Passengers can sleep for few hours, rejuvenate, shower before your next departure in comfort.

faqQuestion: what is the distance between cochin international airport and cochin domestic airport?
faqAnswer: The Cochin International Airport and domestic airport are located  in the same premises. There is only 100m between the terminals

faqQuestion: Can I make an online booking for a child traveling alone on the Air India website ?
faqAnswer: No, passengers cannot make a booking for a child travelling alone. Please contact your nearest Air India office

faqQuestion: Can I make an online booking on Air India website with my credit card if I am not travelling myself ?
faqAnswer:
If the cardholder is not a part of the traveling party, then the passenger should possess:
A photocopy of both sides of the card, which will have to be self attested by the card holder authorising the use of the card for the purchase of the ticket. For security reasons, please strike out the security CVV digits on the copy of the card.
This photocopy should also contain the name of the passenger, the date of journey and the sector on which the journey is made.
The above document MUST be produced at the time of check-in. If the passenger fails to comply with these conditions, Air India reserves the right to deny the passenger(s) from boarding the flight. Our risk management team could send you an email from the email address chargeback@airindia.in, in which you may be asked to send a scanned - masked credit card copy and the signed letter of authority for verification purposes. We request your cooperation in replying to such queries. The details mentioned above do not apply for Net Banking

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet offer connections to other airlines on domestic routes?
faqAnswer: No, SpiceJet does not offer connections to other airlines and takes no responsibility for missed connections. However, on certain sectors, SpiceJet offers connectivity between two SpiceJet flights (Connected sectors). Booking made for connected sectors will be confirmed under a single reservation number, fees & surcharges will be applicable only with respect to one segment.

faqQuestion: Can I cancel/ refund my entire booking on Manage Booking facility on Jet Airways website ?
faqAnswer:
Yes, you can cancel your entire booking and obtain a refund to the same credit card/debit card/banking account used to purchase tickets on www.jetairways.com. 
However, if you have already checked-in using our web or mobile check-in service, kindly call our Contact Centre to cancel the seat reserved during check-in, before requesting for a refund.

faqQuestion: Can JPMiles be transferred?
faqAnswer:
JPMiles can be transferred from one JetPrivilege membership account to another:

Transfer JPMiles can be availed by all members.
A minimum of 500 JPMiles need to be transferred and in multiples of 500 thereon.
Transfer JPMiles at the Rate of Rs.200/- per block of 500 JPMiles
No maximum limit on the number of JPMiles that can be transferred.
JPMiles can be transferred to only one account at a time.
Transfer of JPMiles can be processed online or at JetPrivilege service centre
For more information, please refer to Transfer JPMiles section under Redeem JPMiles.

faqQuestion: What are the meal options for GoBusiness reservations provided by GoAir ?
faqAnswer: At GoAir, we like to stand out from the crowd. That's why with a GoBusiness Reservation our customers can expect not only great service from our dedicated cabin crew but also complimentary refreshments & unlimited tea & coffee. Our GoBusiness customers are also provided with the choice of a business newspaper and a weekly magazine on request. If they are back from a business meeting or want to enjoy a relaxing siesta, our helpful cabin crew would always be happy to provide them with a pillow and blanket on request.

faqQuestion: Does Vistara provide an option for group booking ?
faqAnswer:
Vistara provides an option for  Group Booking and it  requires a minimum of 10 passengers travelling on the same booking. Infants will not be included in the total number of passengers, as they do not occupy a seat. The major benefits with group booking are 
• All passengers are in a single PNR at the same fare.
• Reduced fares compared to separate bookings, as online pricing is dynamic and not all
passengers might get the same fare available online.
• Passenger Names submission is not immediate (Only For groups with >7 days to
departure).
• No need for instant full payment (Only for Groups with >21 days to departure).

faqQuestion: Does Vistara provide discounts for Senior Citizens ?
faqAnswer: At Vistara, we offer special Senior Citizen discount - an opportunity to get an attractive 10% off on the base fare when you book your Economy Class ticket with us via airvistara.com.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet provide any food or drinks onboard for international travel?
faqAnswer:
SpiceJet sells hot meals/snacks/refreshments and beverages on selected flights. Alcoholic beverages are available for sale onboard only on international flights. Payment for the same will be accepted only in INR, Dollars (USD) & the currency of destination city except the currency LKR,MVR,NPR.
In order to comply with certain local regulations in various states/countries, the consumption of alcohol on International flights may be prohibited.
SpiceJet has the right to restrict the quantity of alcohol served on its International flights. Consumption of self-carried alcohol (bought at the Duty Free/otherwise) is prohibited.
Regulatory norms restrict the airline from serving alcohol to individuals below 18 years of age on its International Flights. The cabin crew may seek age proof prior to serving alcohol.

faqQuestion: Where is Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai located ?
faqAnswer: Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai  operates domestic airlines - SpiceJet, IndiGo and GoAir from Terminal 1 located at Santacruz (E), Mumbai and the airlines Vistara, AirIndia and Jet Airways from Terminal 2 located at Sahar, Andheri (E), Mumbai. All the international operations are carried out from Terminal

faqQuestion: Does Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad have smoking areas
faqAnswer: As per Government Order smoking is banned in public areas. At Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad there are specially designed Smoking Lounges at Departures and Arrivals. Please Note Defaulters will attract a fine.

faqQuestion: Can I carry a kirpan in the passenger cabin?
faqAnswer: Yes.  If you are a Sikh passenger and traveling in domestic flight in India. The size of kirpan should not be more than 6 inch blade and 3 inch handle.

faqQuestion: Whether NOC is required for endorsement of multi-engine on Indian CPL?
faqAnswer: Indian Pilots going abroad for multi-engine endorsement training in an ICAO Contracting State in their own interest are required to get the training syllabus approved by DGCA.

faqQuestion: Whether a person can get Instructor Rating on FAA licence and the same will be converted on Indian CPL?
faqAnswer: on FAA licences can be validated as per the requirements laid down in CAR Section 7, Series G, Part II.

faqQuestion: Whether a person can carry out flying on any Multi Engine aircraft on Indian CPL in case only one type of ME is already endorsed on license?
faqAnswer: As per the aircraft rules a person cannot exercise the privileges of his CPL on the aircraft which is not endorsed on his CPL.

faqQuestion: How can I use the special services offered by IndiGo ?
faqAnswer: To ensure availability, these special service requests should be reserved and paid for in advance of travel, via IndiGo Call Centre

faqQuestion: What is the policy for expectant mothers travelling on IndiGo ?
faqAnswer: In case of normal pregnancies, expectant mothers till the end of 32 weeks of pregnancy may be permitted to fly on IndiGo flights provided there are no prior complications. Certificate(s) from the treating obstetrician is required stating the number of weeks the pregnancy has advanced and that the passenger is fit to travel by air. Passengers are required to fill an indemnity bond at the airport before the flight.

faqQuestion: What is the policy of Vistara for child travelers ?
faqAnswer:
At Vistara, children below the age of 18 are classified into four categories:

Infants younger than 7 days
Infants between 7 days and 2 years
Children between the age of 5 and 12 years
Young travellers between the age of 13 and 18 years
With Vistara, you can rest assured your children are in good hands as our staff take extra care with these young customers.

In the interests of safety, we recommend you keep the following in mind:

If your infant is younger than 7 days, you require medical authorization from our Customer Service Centre.

If your infant is between 7 days and 2 years of age, they require valid ID.

If your children are between the ages of 5 and 12, they are permitted to travel as unaccompanied minors. Under our Vistara Youngstar service for Unaccompanied Minors, they will be escorted by specially trained airline staff. We ensure assistance during all processes, and ensure their safety, comfort and privacy in-flight on their very own adventure. Your children will then be handed over at the destination to the authorized individual specified in the UM form. A fee of INR 2500/- will be charged for each unaccompanied minor.

Parents/guardians have to ensure that all Unaccompanied Minor (UM) customers are carrying the correct photo identification, which is mandatory for travel.

If your children are between the ages of 13 and 18, they may travel as young customers once an adult has waived unaccompanied minor handling. This involves validation through “UM Assistance and Handling Waiver Form”. However, should you find the need for UM handling assistance, we will be glad to extend help.

Please keep in mind that young customers will not be considered as escorts for minors aged between 5 and 12 years

faqQuestion: Is there a left luggage facility (cloak room) available at CSIA? For how long can one leave their baggage at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
The left luggage facility (cloak room) is available at Terminal 1 and Terminal (T2) at the arrival hall. Passengers may leave their luggage at these facilities for a period of maximum 90 days.
For more information please visit - www.csia.in/passenger/left-luggage.aspx

faqQuestion: Are auto rickshaws allowed inside Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer: The regular Bangalore auto rickshaws are not allowed inside the Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru campus beyond the Trumpet Flyover. Passengers can get dropped at the entrance to the Trumpet Flyover on NH 7, connecting the city to Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru. Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru has a dedicated Shuttle Bus service starting from the Trumpet Flyover to the Airport Terminal Building for a minimum charge of Rs.10.

faqQuestion: Are two-wheelers allowed within the Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru campus? What are the parking facilities for them?
faqAnswer: Yes, two-wheelers are allowed within the Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru campus. They can be parked at the designated parking facility at Rs. 20.

faqQuestion: Do you have any assistance or porter service available at the Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer:
Yes, Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru has a dedicated porter service for your assistance. Porters are available on the curb side, or passengers can ask the Parking Assistant for a porter.

Charges
Domestic Arrival: Rs. 200
International Arrival: Rs. 300
Domestic Departure: Rs. 200
International Departure: Rs. 200
Note: please do not encourage or tip our porters.

faqQuestion: What are the Helpline and Flight Enquiry contacts at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer:
Flight Enquiry Helpline (24 hours)080 - 6678 2251, 6678 2252, 6678 2255 or 1800-425-4425 (toll free; accessible through the mobile)
General Enquiry Helpline (24 hours)080 - 6678 2258, 6678 2259

faqQuestion: When is fog anticipated at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer: Weather being a natural phenomenon, this is difficult to forecast. However, fog is anticipated from November 15 to February 15, between 03:00 to 08:30 IST at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru.

faqQuestion: Is there a day/transit hotel facility available at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
Yes, there is. Nestled within the airport at Level 1 of Terminal 2 is the transit hotel & lounge – Niranta. From lavish rooms to high speed WiFi, flight information display system, separate work area and sumptuous meal options, the Niranta Airport Transit Hotel offers it all.
Get more details, here: http://csia.in/passenger/niranta.aspx

faqQuestion: Where is the Pharmacy located Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
Apollo Pharmacy at International Terminal operates from the Medical Room behind check-in island M at the departure level 4.
Apollo Pharmacy at Domestic Terminal is located in the departure area, Terminal 1 before the security check points.

faqQuestion: What is the process for obtaining export certificate for precious jewellery(Jewellery, Gem stones, etc.) at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
Passengers travelling with precious jewellery from Mumbai need to submit a certificate to customs while departing from Mumbai. This certificate needs can be obtained minimum 1 day in advance of your date of travel. The certificate will be issued by PCCCC - Precious Cargo Customs Clearance Centre, which is located at Bharat Diamond Bourse, G Block, Bandra Kurla Complex, Bandra (East), Mumbai 400051. Contact No: 02226754000.
For more details please visit - www.customsmumbaiairport.gov.in/forms/Content.aspx?LinkID=40

faqQuestion: Does Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi have smoking areas?
faqAnswer: In an effort to keep the environment clean, all terminals at Indira Gandhi International Airport provide dedicated smoking lounges. These lounges are located inside the terminals, after security screening. Smoking in any other area is prohibited.

faqQuestion: Do you have a visitor area at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad ?
faqAnswer: The area outside Arrival Hall is the Meeter’s and Greeters area and is known as the Airport Village. Visitors are permitted to enter the Airport Village on purchase of an Entry Ticket of Rs. 20/- (subject to certain conditions).

faqQuestion: Does Chennai International Airport  have smoking areas
faqAnswer: Smoking lounge facility is available at the Security Hold Area of both International & Domestic Terminals of Chennai International Airport .

faqQuestion: What are the details of car parking in Cochin International Airport ?
faqAnswer: The Cochin International Airport offers ample parking facility. The covered area alone can house 1400 cars. There is no need of booking. Please drive in and get your vehicle parked as long as you wish.

faqQuestion: Can I avail of Companion offers online on the Air India website?
faqAnswer: No, currently this facility is not available for online booking; passengers may please contact your nearest Air India office.

faqQuestion: Can I purchase an open-dated ticket when I book online on the Air India website?
faqAnswer: No. The selected sectors must be booked on a confirmed basis and paid for at the same time.

faqQuestion: Can I cancel / change my booking on IndiGo Family Fare?
faqAnswer: Yes, passengers can cancel or change the Family Fare booking. Please refer Conditions of Carriage for change/cancellation fee and detailed T&Cs

faqQuestion: Can I partially cancel my bookings done on IndiGo Family Fare?
faqAnswer: Yes, passengers can partially cancel a booking on Family Fare.

faqQuestion: What type of aircraft does SpiceJet fly on domestic routes?
faqAnswer: SpiceJet flies Boeing 737-800's and 737-900 ER's configured with single class with a seating capacity of 189 and 212 respectively. In addition to this SpiceJet has added the Q400 NextGen turboprop aircraft from Bombardier, which can accommodate 78 passengers on a single class configuration.

faqQuestion: What is the validity period of the JPMiles that I have earned?
faqAnswer:
JPMiles are valid up to the end of the thirteenth quarter from the quarter in which they were earned. e.g. JPMiles earned in the 1st quarter of 2009 (JAN-FEB-MAR) will expire on March 31, 2012.

JetPrivilege Platinum members enjoy an exclusive benefit of “Non-Expiry of JPMiles” whereby the JPMiles do not expire from the membership account until the member retains his JetPrivilege Platinum tier. Jet Airways Co-brand cardholders enjoy extended validity of 5 years for their JPMiles.

faqQuestion: Can I redeem JPMiles online? What is the procedure for the same?
faqAnswer:
Yes. You can redeem JPMiles online. 
Login to your JetPrivilege account at jetairways.com
Click on JetPrivilege, Select Redeem JPMiles, Redeem JPMiles online.
Thereafter follow the instructions given to book, pay and print your e-tickets online. 

Alternatively, you can also redeem your JPMiles on jetprivilege.com OR fill up the online Award Request form at jetairways.com or download and email the form duly filled and signed by the member to jpredemptions@jetprivilege.com.

faqQuestion: Can I use Jet Airways Kiosk Check-in for International flights?
faqAnswer: Yes. Kiosk Check-in is available for Jet Airways international flights.

faqQuestion: "What is the definition of Unaccompanied Minor Passenger? Is a Parent allowed to accompany a child during check-in? "
faqAnswer: An unaccompanied minor is a child without the presence of a legal guardian. This term is used in immigration law and in airline policies. The specific definition varies from country to country and from airline to airline. Please check with the airline for further information.

faqQuestion: Whether FRTOL can be issued without RTR (A) of Ministry of Communication?
faqAnswer: No. The requirements for issue of FRTOL are laid down in Section ‘Y’ of the Schedule II of the Aircraft Rules.

faqQuestion: Whether recency of flying to be considered valid in case documents are submitted prior to the same i.e. ﬂying experience of 15 hours as PIC in the preceding six months?
faqAnswer: in all respect for issue of license

faqQuestion: Whether a Pilot can get endorsement on an aircraft already available in India?
faqAnswer: Pilots are granted type endorsement on their Indian licences to fly aircrafts registered in India having valid C of A and C of R.

faqQuestion: What is the requirement to acquire additional or extension of aircraft rating on Multi-engine?
faqAnswer: Pilots holding Indian license are required to seek approval of their flying training syllabus from DGCA for obtaining Multiengine rating.

faqQuestion: if l need a wheelchair what should I do? Is there a charge?
faqAnswer: If a wheelchair is needed, the request should be placed at the time of reservation, ticketing or reconfirmation of the booking. Passengers are requested to pre-book wheelchairs at the time of flight booking / ticket issuance to avoid last minute delays / non availability of wheelchairs.

faqQuestion: Is there any Child Care room at Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport Kolkata ?
faqAnswer: Child Care rooms are available at various locations for facilitating nursing mothers travelling through Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport

faqQuestion: Is there any Child Care room at Chennai International Airport ?
faqAnswer: Child care rooms are available at Domestic (5nos.) & International (2nos.) Terminals for providing essentials to the child/infant such as feeding, changing diapers etc.

faqQuestion: What is the policy for unaccompanied minor travelling with GoAir ?
faqAnswer:
GoAir is happy to help kids fly solo. We accept unaccompanied minors between the age of 5 and 12 years, upon a payment of a nominal fee of ₹ 1,500/-. 
At the time of booking, the Unaccompanied Minor Service should be requested, either on the GoAir website (www.GoAir.in), directly at the GoAir office, via a GoAir contact centre or through a travel agent. 

For children traveling alone (unaccompanied minors), we provide separate check-in facilities on departure with dedicated GoAir staff to accompany them to the aircraft. A parent or a guardian is required to complete a signed UMR form at the point of check-in at each departure airport prior to travel. They must provide the name and the contact number(s) of a parent or a guardian who will meet the unaccompanied minor at the point of arrival. Parents or guardians are advised to present the child for check-in at least two hours prior the departure and must remain at the airport until the flight has departed. 

At the destination, the unaccompanied minor is introduced to a member of our staff who will escort them to the arrivals, where they will be handed over to the parent or the guardian noted on the form. For security reasons, the parent or the guardian will be required to show their formal identification, the details of which will be noted. 

Note: Children between the age group of 5-12 years will be considered and treated as an unaccompanied minor even if they are accompanied by a customer who is in the age group of 13 years to 18 years.

faqQuestion: What If my Baggage is missing at Airport ?
faqAnswer: If your bags are delayed, try not to panic. The airlines typically have ways to track them, and the vast majority of misplaced luggage is returned eventually. If your bags are on the next flight, you could have them within a few hours. If they have been sent to the wrong airport, it could take a couple of days. Make sure to file your claim immediately at the airport and to give the attendant a hotel or home address, as well as a phone number where you can be reached.

faqQuestion: Is left luggage facility available at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: The Left Luggage Facility is available in T3 and is located in the Multi Car Parking Facility, across from the terminal.

faqQuestion: How can I make an enquiry on the lost baggage including the tag number details after departing from Cochin International Airport ?
faqAnswer:
In Cochin airport, lost and mishandled baggages are  handled by Air India, which  is the ground handling agency. Their contact no is 0484 2610115 (2601 extension)
For tracking any missed belongings/items at the airport, go to CISF website or contact CISF control room at 0484- 2611422

faqQuestion: How early should I arrive at the airport?
faqAnswer: Check with your airline or travel agent to determine how early to arrive at the airport. Recommended check-in times differ by airline/airport and change during peak travel times.

faqQuestion: What can I do if my property is lost: missing or damaged during the baggage screening process or at the Security Checkpoint?
faqAnswer: It is our job to assure you - the passenger - that BCAS/Airlines/Aviation Security Group can and will deliver excellence in security and customer service.

faqQuestion: What are the parking charges at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer:
At Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru, we have a spacious, comfortable parking area which can accommodate about 2,000 vehicles. Our parking charges vary according to the time taken by passengers or visitors.
24/7 Parking Helpline : 9538882020

faqQuestion: Is it possible to park my own car at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru , in case of a day trip ?
faqAnswer:
Passengers can utilize the long-term parking facility as well as valet parking service provided at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru.

Regular long-term parking:
Long term Parking Fees remains same in P2 Parking area only.
Rs. 500 for day one (24 hours) and Rs. 300 for every additional day, thereafter.

faqQuestion: What are the standard procedures that need to be completed on arrival in Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
International passengers - Upon arrival, a clearance from immigrations and customs is a must for all the passengers travelling internationally. There are seperate check points for both immigrations and customs.
All passengers of foreign nationality arriving in Mumbai will need to fill in the arrival card and present the same with a valid passport & visa at the immigration counter. It is mandatory that the passport has a validity of at least 6 months.
All Indian nationals arriving in Mumbai will need to clear immigrations by presenting the valid travel documents i.e. passport and visa.
Post clearance from immigrations and customs all the passengers may collect their respective baggage/s from the baggage hall and proceed towards the arrival exit.
Domestic passengers - On arrival, domestic passengers may collect their baggage/s from the baggage hall and proceed towards the arrival exit.m

faqQuestion: What is the liquor duty free allowance for passengers arriving via international flights in Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer: All passengers entering India are eligible for duty free liquor allowance. One can purchase up to 2 litres of wine or alcoholic beverages. For more details, please visit - mumbaicustoms3.gov.in

faqQuestion: If Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi is affected by Fog or adverse weather, what should I do about my flight ?
faqAnswer: In the first instance, you must always contact your airline for information on flight arrivals and departures. When there is fog impact, airlines usually combine flights on a larger aircraft or reallocate aircraft operating a specific flight. Customers should check flight status before starting from home in case of fog. Passenger are also advised to maintain calm and cooperate with Airport staff who does their best in handling the challenge imposed on them by mother nature.

faqQuestion: Is there any Airline Lounge facility at Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport Kolkata ?
faqAnswer: Lounge facility is available in Domestic and International wings of Terminal-2. The Lounges are located in the Security hold Area and the passengers can spend free time leisurely before boarding. The lounge in Domestic Security Hold Area is run by M/s East India Hotels (Clipper Lounge) and the Lounge in International Security Hold Area is managed by M/s P.K.Hospitality Private Limited (Port Lounge).

faqQuestion: What is IndiGo Family Fare ?
faqAnswer:
A family of 4 to 9 passengers can book special Family Fare and save upto 10% on base fare and fuel charge.
Family Fare is currently applicable only on Domestic India Network.

faqQuestion: What are IndiGo Fare rules ?
faqAnswer:
The rules and conditions of the booking depend on the fare type and are mentioned in the fare rules. In certain select cases (for example, certain corporate houses etc.), IndiGo offers special fares and certain special privileges on those fares, at the time of making the booking (“Special Fares”). These Special Fares have terms and conditions attached to them. In the event that the booking is made on the Special Fares, except to the extent specified otherwise in the terms and conditions governing the Special Fares, the conditions of carriage of IndiGo shall apply in its entirety   In the event of a conflict between a provision contained herein and in the terms and conditions attached to the Special Fares, the provision as contained in the latter shall prevail and take precedence. 

Our fares are refundable, subject to the change or cancellation rules. 

To secure the best price, it is recommended that you book well in advance of travel dates. 

All IndiGo fares are quoted in Indian Rupees (Rs or INR). IndiGo fares apply only for carriage from the airport at the point of origin to the airport at the point of destination. Fares do not include ground transport service between airports and between airports and town terminals. 

Fares and schedules are subject to change without notice. IndiGo's schedule is also subject to regulatory authority approvals. Once purchased, your fare will not change; provided, however, that if you request a subsequent change in the booking or routing, revised fares may be applicable. 

Customers traveling with IndiGo are required to agree to terms and conditions that are available on goindigo.in or on request at our Airport Counters.

faqQuestion: Is an IndiGo booking transferrable ?
faqAnswer: IndiGo bookings are not transferable. If someone other than the customer attempts to travel or to obtain a refund in connection with the booking, IndiGo shall not be liable to the customer so entitled if in good faith it provides carriage or makes a refund to the person presenting the itinerary.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet provide any food or drinks onboard for domestic travel?
faqAnswer: SpiceJet sells hot meals/snacks/refreshments and beverages on selected flights. Payment for the same will be accepted in INR only.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet offer a frequent flyer program for domestic travel?
faqAnswer: No, SpiceJet do not offer a frequent flyer program.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet allow me to bring food on board  to eat for domestic travel ?
faqAnswer: SpiceJet does allow some food items on board. Those include: burgers, sandwiches, cold snacks, non-alcoholic drinks, cookies, and biscuits. Some items not allowed on-board due to hygiene issues are: samosas, pakoras, gravies or pickles. If you have any questions, please contact our Passenger Reservations.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet allow me to bring food on board  to eat for international travel ?
faqAnswer: SpiceJet does allow some food items on board. Those include - burgers, sandwiches, cold snacks, non-alcoholic drinks, cookies, and biscuits. If Passengers have any further questions, please contact our Passenger Reservations.

faqQuestion: What is Jet Airways Best Price Promise?
faqAnswer: Jet Airways Best Price Promise symbol guarantees the best online fares for all Jet Airways operated flights, exclusively on jetairways.com, our mobile site and app Wherever you see Best Price Promise symbol you can be rest assured that you won’t find a better Jet Airways fare anywhere else online.

faqQuestion: What are JPMiles?
faqAnswer: JPMiles are the programme currency of JetPrivilege, a loyalty and rewards management programme and the frequent flyer programme of Jet Airways. Each time you fly or transact with any of our 150+ programme partners you earn JPMiles. They are equivalent to reward points or frequent flyer miles of other loyalty programmes.

faqQuestion: Do I earn JPMiles on all Jet Airways flights?
faqAnswer: Yes. With the multi-level JPMiles earning, you earn a percentage of the base JPMiles based on the Flight, Network and Cabin booked. Effective travel on or after 17th August 2016, Base JPMiles will also be dependent upon the Fare Choices selected. For travel on Jet Airways marketed & operated flights and on Jet Airways flights operated under the S2 code, the Base JPMiles will continue to be calculated as a percentage of 500 Miles (for sectors where Ticketed Point Mileage (TPM) is less than or equal to 500 miles) and as a percentage of actual Ticketed Point Mileage (TPM) (only for sectors where the distance flown is 501 miles & above). In case of Jet Airways codeshare flights operated by Airline Partners, Base JPMiles will continue to be calculated as a percentage of the actual Ticketed Point Mileage irrespective of the distance.

faqQuestion: When can I start redeeming JPMiles?
faqAnswer: You can start redeeming JPMiles on completing any 1 activity with the programme. A member has to ensure that he/she has undergone mobile and email verification for his/her account to be able to undertake a redemption.

faqQuestion: What are the meal options for economy reservations provided by GoAir ?
faqAnswer:
Customers travelling economy can avail our buy on board meal services. 
GoAir sells a variety of well selected Café Coffee Day snacks (veg & non-veg) and beverages (cold and hot) on board. Sandwiches, combo snacks, savouries, knick-knacks, cookies, energy bars, selection of cold and hot beverages and water are some of the items on the menu. Customers may purchase the same against cash payment. We do not accept credit card/debit cards or cheques. 
Now customers can pre-purchase Combo Meal at the time of booking ticket(s) on www.GoAir.in. Customers can choose between a vegetarian and non-vegetarian Combo Meal as per their preference.

faqQuestion: Does GoAir offer priority checkin ?
faqAnswer:
GoAir offers priority check-in and priority baggage at just ₹​ 400 and the service can be bought by passenger up to 2 hours before the scheduled departure.

This is a pre-paid service and can be bought by paying a non-refundable fee of ₹​ 400/- for 2 bags
This service is available only at selective airports – AMD, BLR, BOM, CCU, COK, DEL, GAU, GOI, IXZ & MAA
This service is available for first 10 customers on every flight

faqQuestion: What are the details of car parking in Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ? Is self car parking available at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: Self driven cars can be parked at the Multi Level Car Park located across from Terminal 3 and the Surface Car Park located across from Terminal 1. Please click http://www.newdelhiairport.in/delhi-airport-parking-services.aspx to check all details pertaining to parking at the airport.

faqQuestion: What may happen to me if l bring a prohibited item to a security checkpoint?
faqAnswer: If you bring a prohibited item to the checkpoint you may be criminally prosecuted or at the least asked to rid yourself of the item

faqQuestion: Whether a person can submit the paper without RTR (A) from Ministry of Communication?
faqAnswer: then only the application would be processed for issue of license.

faqQuestion: if l require oxygen supply on board what are the formalities?
faqAnswer: You will be required to prepare and submit a Medical Information form (MEDIF).

faqQuestion: Where is the Medical Room located at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer: The medical room at International Terminal (T2) is located near check-in island L at the departure level 4 and arrival corridor of the South West Pier at Level 2. The medical room at Domestic Terminal 1 is located in departure area next to check-in counter 1.

faqQuestion: What is the definition of Unaccompanied Minor Passenger? Is a Parent allowed to accompany a child during check-in?
faqAnswer: An unaccompanied minor is a child without the presence of a legal guardian. This term is used in immigration law and in airline policies. The specific definition varies from country to country and from airline to airline. Please check with the airline for further information.

faqQuestion: Does Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi have any medical facility ?
faqAnswer:
In the event of a medical emergency, well trained doctors and paramedics are available from the emergency treatment centre run by Medanta Hospital, the Medicity. These doctors and paramedics are available round the clock. 

The Medanta Medical Centres are equipped with emergency treatment centre for passengers & visitors alike. Ambulances are provided to cater to any severe medical emergency. Medanta Medical facility is available at T-1, T-2 and T-3. Fortis Medical Facility is also available at T-3.

faqQuestion: Are differently abled passengers offered assistance by crew to use lavatory on IndiGo ?
faqAnswer: A lavatory with a single panel door and additional grab bar is available on all our aircraft. Our cabin crew can provide assistance moving to and from the lavatory door(same as above), but will not be able to assist the customer inside the lavatory.

faqQuestion: What is the policy for expectant mothers travelling on GoAir ?
faqAnswer:
Following guidelines apply to safeguard the health of the mother and the baby:

Provided the pregnancy has been uncomplicated and the customer is not experiencing a related medical condition, there is no problem flying whilst pregnant until the 28th week. 

For traveling between 28-36 weeks, a medical certification as Fit to Fly as Customer on date of travel is required from the treating doctor. For the safety of the customer, GoAir reserves the right, under certain circumstances, to refuse boarding if the customer chooses to not carry a medical certificate.

Travel after the 36th week of gestation is not permitted. 

Newborn babies can travel from Day 7, if born on or after the due date with no complications. In case of caesarean section and/or complicated delivery they can fly after 2 weeks.

faqQuestion: How do I transport a Firearm or Ammunition?
faqAnswer: There are specific regulations governing the transport of firearms, firearm parts, and ammunition.

faqQuestion: What is the permissible size of hand baggage allowed for air passengers?
faqAnswer: 115 cm total of all dimensions except at Srinagar airport where carry-on (hand baggage) is not allowed.

faqQuestion: What is the left luggage facility at Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport Kolkata?
faqAnswer: There is left luggage/baggage storage facilities to safely and securely store your luggage at the airport terminal. Baggage and luggage items can be stored for a few hours or up to 30 days. All items are subject to security checks, including X-ray screening and random hand searches. The facility operates 24 x 7 and booking of can be done at the Arrival Level - Counter No 18 (near Gate 3C) and Departure Level - Airport Manager's office (Gate 3C). Both Domestic and International passengers can leave luggage for a maximum of 30 days at Charges are Rs.20/- per baggage (for 24 hours period). Beyond 24 hours or part there off, Rs.40/- per day per baggage will be charged For any assistance / enquiry, contact

faqQuestion: What are the baggage allowances for GoAir operated flights ?
faqAnswer: As per GoAir revised policy effective 20th Jul'16 customers can now avail free baggage of 15 kg for Economy and 35 kg for Business travel. Customers will have to pay ₹ 350/- per kg. Customers who have bought GoLite our Hand Baggage only fares before April 19th, 2016, can purchase check-in baggage of 15 kg on their ticket, only from airport / call centre by paying ₹ 400/- for 15 kg. Infants do not have any check-in baggage allowance. However customers traveling with an infant are allowed to carry one extra cabin baggage weighing not more than 7 Kg and a fully collapsible baby's wrap or a blanket.

faqQuestion: Where can I get baggage in airport
faqAnswer: In airport terminal section

faqQuestion: How should I pack before my ﬂight?
faqAnswer: There are different restrictions on what you can pack in your carry-on & checked baggage. All of your baggage will be screened and possibly hand-searched as part of the new security measures.

faqQuestion: Till what visibility Range is the Airport Operational at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru ?
faqAnswer: Aircrafts can undertake normal Operations at Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru till Runway Visual Range (RVR) is 400M.

faqQuestion: Where is the smoking zone located at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
There are designated smoking areas at both Domestic and International terminals of Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA)  Mumbai.
For information on the locations, please visit - www.csia.in/passenger/smoking-zones.aspx

faqQuestion: How do I travel between terminals at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: Inter terminal transfer coaches are provided which connect passengers between Terminal 3 and Terminal 1D . A Inter Terminal Transfer Helpdesk is located outside the arrival terminals for assistance.

faqQuestion: How do I travel between terminals at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad ?
faqAnswer: There is only one integrated terminal and Please follow the signages or kindly get in touch with the Airport staff who will assist you or for any assistance Please contact the Information counter available at the Meeter’s and Greeters area for assistance.

faqQuestion: What are the details of car parking in Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad ?
faqAnswer: The Parking at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad is managed by Tenaga Parking with the unique ‘Touch and Go’ concept. Contact for more information : Tenaga Car Park: 04066604205/10

faqQuestion: What is the distance / direction of the Cochin International Airport from Cochin City?
faqAnswer:
Cochin International Airport is located 28 km northeast of downtown Kochi in an area known as  
Nedumbassery.   It is centrally situated between NH 47 (Kanyakumari-Salem Highway) and MC Road (Trivandrum-Angamaly).
Angamaly (AFK)   is the nearest railway station (9 KM). But some trains stop  Aluva (AWY) station (14KM) only.

faqQuestion: Are there any Guest rooms facility at Cochin International Airport ?
faqAnswer:
Five guest rooms are available at domestic terminal building of Cochin International Airport
Tariff
Rs. 4720/- (including tax) for Suite Room
Rs. 2688/- (including tax) for delex Room
Booking contact: 8589 999 300

faqQuestion: Can I make the booking online on the Air India website and pay at any of the Air India offices?
faqAnswer: Due to ticketing regulations, a different fare may apply if you wish to pay for the tickets at an Air India office. The fares displayed online are for sale and payment made throughhttp://www.airindia.in/ only.

faqQuestion: What bookings can be made using the Concessionary fare types on the Air India website?
faqAnswer: Currently passengers may use the Concessionary fare types link for making an online booking for domestic travel within India only. The concessions offered are for Senior Citizen, Youth, Students and other Government and Military concessions, the details of which can be viewed on the link: concessionary-fare.htm If in case Senior citizen fares are valid for international travel (as the same are introduced periodically) the details will be viewable on the above link.

faqQuestion: What type of aircraft does IndiGo fly?
faqAnswer: IndiGo operates the Airbus A320–200 CEO & NEO aircraft and the ATR 72-600 aircraft. The seating capacity on A320 fleet is 180 and ATR Fleet is 74.

faqQuestion: Can I switch from IndiGo Family Fare to other fare?
faqAnswer: Once passengers have opted for IndiGo Family Fare option, you cannot switch to any other option of fares. Any such change will be considered a change of booking and the applicable change fee and difference of fare will accordingly apply.

faqQuestion: Can my organisation become a member of the JetPrivilege programme?
faqAnswer: Membership to JetPrivilege is restricted to individuals only. However, with the launch of the Business Rewards+ programme, small and medium enterprises can now be enrolled into the JetPrivilege programme and have a company level JetPrivilege account. Currently enrolment into the Business Rewards+ programme is available only by subscribing to the corporate co-brand credit card offered by our banking partner - American Express. Please note; the Business Rewards+ programme feature is currently available only for member’s within India.

faqQuestion: How do I earn JPMiles if I’m not a frequent flyer?
faqAnswer: JetPrivilege has 100+ non-airline partners across categories such as banking, hotels, retail, dining, publishing lifestyle to name a few, making earning of JPMiles extremely easy. JetPrivilege has also partnered with leading banks (HDFC, ICICI, IndusInd & American Express) to offer co-brand credit & debit cards which means you can earn JPMiles on every spend you make!

faqQuestion: How do I book my JetPrivilege Award ticket through a travel agent?
faqAnswer: Travel agents are not permitted to book JetPrivilege Award tickets. You can book, redeem your JPMiles, pay and print your award ticket online at jetairways.com. Alternatively, you can also redeem your JPMiles on jetprivilege.com OR you can fill up the online Travel Request at jetairways.com OR download and email the Award Travel Request Form duly filled and signed by the member to jpredemptions@jetprivilege.com.

faqQuestion: Does GoAir offer Student Fares ?
faqAnswer:
The following guidelines are applicable for Student Fares.
. Student fare will be available for bookings done online on www.GoAir.in by opting in for student fare
. GoAir will provide 5% discount on base fare only. All applicable fees/taxes payable by the student.
. Scheme is applicable for students above the age of 12 years, who belong to a recognized School / University that issues a bonafide Student ID card
. It is mandatory for the students to carry a valid student ID card as well as valid Govt approved photo ID and display it at the time of check-in at the airport.
. Scheme is valid for students only. Not applicable for family members.
. Student discount is applicable for all domestic flights.
. Student discount is valid on both, one-way and round-trip bookings.
. Bookings made under Student Discount Scheme are changed or cancelled. However, only one modification is allowed by calling at the call centre
. Tickets booked under the scheme are non-transferable - No name changes permitted.
. Web Check-in is not allowed for all the Student Discount bookings.
. Limited inventory available under the scheme and seats are subject to availability.
. Scheme cannot be combined with any other offers/discounts/promotions from GoAir.
. GoAir reserves the right to amend/modify/cancel the scheme without any prior intimation.
. Bookings under this offer are refundable after deducting the applicable cancellation fares.
. An excess baggage of 25 kg (Standard 15 + 10) will be allowed at Airport only after Student showing a valid student ID card as well as valid Govt approved photo ID.
. This offer is applicable for international students also
. A valid student ID card as well as valid Govt approved photo ID and international boarding pass of travel within 24 hours needs to be presented to avail this offer

faqQuestion: What is Vistara WomanFlyer ?
faqAnswer: Vistara is thrilled to present #VistaraWomanFlyer. An industry-first service designed especially for our women travelers. As part of this unique initiative, female passengers can choose their desired seat from among a window or an aisle seat, while female passengers traveling alone will additionally enjoy special baggage and transport assistance on arrival, completely free of cost.

faqQuestion: Whether a person holding FAA license can do recency flying in India?
faqAnswer: A person holding FAA licence can do recency flying in India in any of the Flying Training Institute approved by the DGCA subject to comply with the provisions of Rule 6, Rule 38A, Rule 39B of the Aircraft Rules, 1937 i.e. the applicant must have a valid Indian Student Pilot Licence, Valid FRTOL and he medical.

faqQuestion: Whether a person holding FAA licence can do recency flying in Philippines?
faqAnswer: No. However, a person can fly a foreign registered aircraft in accordance with the Rules being followed by the Regulatory Authority of the State where the aircraft is operating.

faqQuestion: How to obtain a RTR?
faqAnswer: RTR is issued by Central Government through Ministry of Communication under Indian Wireless Telegraphy Rules, 1954. For details please see their website www.dot.gov.in

faqQuestion: Is it essential to submit original documents while applying for issue conversion of license?
faqAnswer: The list of documents to be submitted for issue / conversion of license is given at serial number 21 of the application Performa available on DGCA web site www.dgca.nic.in under the tab forms.

faqQuestion: Whether a person can continue ﬂying when a pilot is not having valid medical class-l or Class-II ?
faqAnswer: No person can fly without valid medical.

faqQuestion: where can I find the terminal list of landing flights
If I need a wheelchair, what should I do? Is there a charge?
faqAnswer: If a wheelchair is needed, the request should be placed at the time of reservation, ticketing or reconfirmation of the booking. Passengers are requested to pre-book wheelchairs at the time of flight booking / ticket issuance to avoid last minute delays / non availability of wheelchairs.

faqQuestion: If l require a stretcher what are the formalities that require to be completed?
faqAnswer: You will be required to prepare and submit a Medical Information form (MEDIF).

faqQuestion: What in have special medications that I must carry with me?
faqAnswer: If you require special medication, you should always carry your prescription with you when you board any flight. Different countries have different laws governing the possession of prescription drugs, and some countries have limited supplies should you require a refill of your prescription, so it is always better to bring an extra supply with you. For further information concerning any particular medications, consult with your physician and contact the local embassy of the country to which you are travelling.

faqQuestion: Does Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai have a prayer room ?
faqAnswer: Yes. Prayer rooms are available at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA)  Mumbai International Terminal (T2) at level 4 & 3

faqQuestion: Is there any Child Care lounge facility at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: For the privacy of mothers who wish to nurse their infants, a well-equipped Child Care Lounge with toys, baby cot is available at all terminals of Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi .

faqQuestion: What are the facilities available for passengers with special needs at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: All terminals at Indira Gandhi International Airport have been designed to ensure safe movement of passengers with reduced mobility. Designated car parking bays, elevators, reclined passenger movers have been installed ,to enhance the airport experience. A special counter, located near gate number 1 at Terminal 3 and gate number 8 at T1D has been placed to facilitate passengers who need wheel chairs. A passenger can also call “Special Assistance” from the telephone installed at the curb side of Terminal 3 Gate no. 1 in departures at T-2

faqQuestion: Are there extra charges for the special services offered by IndiGo ?
faqAnswer: Since these services are not used by everybody, IndiGo charges specific fees to customers using special services only.

faqQuestion: How does IndiGo classify an infant
faqAnswer: A customer under 2 years of age is classified as an infant. Proof of age is required so please have the infant's valid photo-ID available for inspection

faqQuestion: Do I need to inform IndiGo if I have any medical condition?
faqAnswer:
Customers who are ailing from any particular medical condition can travel on IndiGo after giving prior medical information as per the medical form provided on the IndiGo Website, in order for IndiGo to provide complete assistance.

 Medical Information must be provided to IndiGo at least 72 hours prior to the scheduled departure of the flight.
The customer must also inform IndiGo regarding any hospitalisation requirement upon arrival. 
In case a Customer will be accompanied by a safety assistant during travel then his/her name and contact details must also be shared with IndiGo.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet allow me to bring my pets on board with me for domestic  travel?
faqAnswer: SpiceJet permits the carriage of live animals on its flights but booked through cargo services. Please refer to the full terms and conditions associated with the carriage of live animals on SpiceJet. Guide dogs for blind Customers are exempt from this rule, but any Customer traveling with a guide dog should make his/her reservation via the SpiceJet Reservations and provide us notice that a guide dog will be traveling. Please note that guide dogs for the blind may not occupy any seat. The Customer is required to bring a moisture absorbent mat, and to place it under the guide dog. Further, the guide dog should be properly trained, restrained and muzzled.

faqQuestion: Is there any Child Care lounge facility at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: For the privacy of mothers who wish to nurse their infants, a well-equipped Child Care Lounge with toys, baby cot is available at all terminals of Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi .

faqQuestion: What are the facilities available for passengers with special needs at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: All terminals at Indira Gandhi International Airport have been designed to ensure safe movement of passengers with reduced mobility. Designated car parking bays, elevators, reclined passenger movers have been installed ,to enhance the airport experience. A special counter, located near gate number 1 at Terminal 3 and gate number 8 at T1D has been placed to facilitate passengers who need wheel chairs. A passenger can also call “Special Assistance” from the telephone installed at the curb side of Terminal 3 Gate no. 1 in departures at T-2

faqQuestion: What is the left luggage facility at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad ?
faqAnswer: Passengers who do not wish to carry their baggage for a short period of time while they go about their business can leave their baggage in the safe custody of an agency for a charge. Left Luggage facility at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad is provided by Make My Trip, having counters at arrivals and departures which operates round the clock. Contact 040 66603677 Make My Trip at Airport Village for Left Luggage facility (Cloak Room services)

faqQuestion: What do I need to know if l am a Traveler with a Disability or Medical Condition?
faqAnswer: In order to assist persons with disabilities or medical concerns, certain guidelines have been developed with input from various groups and have trained our airport screeners in the methodology needed to ensure secure and comfortable screening at all Security Checkpoints.

faqQuestion: Where can I purchase an International SIM card from inside the Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer: For passengers travelling via Terminal T2 to international destinations, international SIM cards can be purchased from the Uniconnect counters located at departure level (level 4) and opposite boarding gate 69.

faqQuestion: What are the details of car parking in Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ? Is self car parking available at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi
faqAnswer: Self driven cars can be parked at the Multi Level Car Park located across from Terminal 3 and the Surface Car Park located across from Terminal 1. Please click http://www.newdelhiairport.in/delhi-airport-parking-services.aspx to check all details pertaining to parking at the airport.

faqQuestion: Is Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi equipped to operate in Fog and Adverse weather?
faqAnswer: Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi has state-of-art CAT IIIB Instrument landing systems equipped on Runways 11, 29 and 28. These systems are the most advanced of its class and provide the guidance required for pilots to land an aircraft in low visibility conditions. While the equipment are available at airport, it also requires aircraft to be equipped on board and pilot to be trained to utilize these systems, i.e.; be CAT IIIB compliant. Most modern aircraft are CAT IIIB compliant and Airlines are required to roster CATIIIB qualified pilots during fog.

faqQuestion: What is the maximum number of travelers for whom I can make an online reservation on the Air India website?
faqAnswer: In one online transaction, passengers can book up to nine (9) passengers, including adults and children in your traveling party. Infants are co-related to the number of adults in the traveling party. The figure could vary in Business and First class depending on the configuration of the aircraft. However for Code Share bookings it is limited to 4 (Four) passengers per booking.

faqQuestion: Does IndiGo offer wait-listed or standby seats ?
faqAnswer: No, IndiGo does not offer wait-listed or standby seats. IndiGo's commitment to serve you with an efficient and precise service results in providing you with a confirmed seat on all IndiGo flights.

faqQuestion: Does IndiGo offer special fares ?
faqAnswer: IndiGo offers discounts to families, serving and retired Armed Forces personnel and their families, Paramilitary Forces personnel and their families and Senior Citizens, subject to specific terms and conditions

faqQuestion: Can I change the name, sector , date and time on my IndiGo booking ?
faqAnswer:
Changes to your name, your origin of travel, and/or your destination of travel are not permitted. 

Changes to the date or time can be made by contacting IndiGo no later than 2 hours before the scheduled departure time for travel within India and 4 hours before the scheduled departure for international travel. You can make changes by contacting IndiGo Call Centre, IndiGo Airport Counters, goindigo.in or through IndiGo Shops, or participating Travel Agents who made the original booking. Changes will result in a fee depending on fare type, and varies for domestic and international flights. The fee will be per customer plus any difference in the fare between the original fare paid and the fare for the revised booking. For reservation processed in currencies other than INR, equivalent charges will be levied.

All fees and surcharges are carried across to the new booking. Depending on the changes requested, additional surcharges or fees may apply.

If the difference in fare, less applicable fees, results in a credit to you, then you shall receive a credit for travel on IndiGo that will remain valid for twelve (12) months from the date of issue.

In the event you choose to opt for a refund, the form of refund will match the form of original payment.

faqQuestion: What type of aircraft does SpiceJet fly on International routes?
faqAnswer: SpiceJet flies Boeing 737-800's and 737-900 ER's configured with single class with a seating capacity of 189 and 212 respectively.

faqQuestion: If I want to book my meals online for my Jet Airways flight, how much advance notice do I have to give ?
faqAnswer: The Online Meal Request is available on the Manage Booking section. For standard meals, the online request should be made at least 2 hours prior to flight departure. For special meals, the online request should be made at least 24 hours prior to flight departure. These timings may change without notice and passengers are requested to verify the same at the time of reservation.

faqQuestion: Which bookings can I use to cancel/refund on Manage Booking facility on Jet Airways website ?
faqAnswer: Cancellation and refund of bookings on Manage Booking facility is available for eTickets that are booked on jetairways.com only and before making any changes. This facility can be utilized for both Domestic and International sectors.

faqQuestion: Is there an age criteria for enrolling into the JetPrivilege programme?
faqAnswer: Yes. Individuals above age of 12 years can enrol directly into the JetPrivilege programme. Children between the age of 2-11 can be enrolled into JetPrivilege through the MyFamily+ programme feature. However, they will have to be enrolled by an existing JetPrivilege member who is either the Parent or the Legal Guardian. The child's JetPrivilege account will be linked to parent / legal Guardian's till the child is 12 years of age, post which the child's account will be delinked and become an independent account. Please note, the MyFamily+ programme feature is currently available only for member’s within India.

faqQuestion: What is Jet Airways Kiosk Check-in?
faqAnswer: Jet Airways is proud to present our Kiosk Check-in service - a convenient and an alternative way to check in at the airport. Kiosk Check-in allows you to select your preferred seat and print your boarding pass in 4-simple steps.

faqQuestion: Who can use Jet Airways Kiosk Check-in?
faqAnswer:
Kiosk check-in service can be availed by following guest :
- Holding a confirmed , valid eTicket .
- Anytime between 45 minutes and 24 hours prior to flight departure for domestic and 60 minutes to 24 hours for international . 
- For guests departing from an airport where Kiosk check-in is available;

faqQuestion: What services does GoAir provide under GoBusiness ?
faqAnswer:
The GoBusiness service is a product offered by GoAir to customers who prefer traveling in Business Class comfort at almost economy prices. GoAir GoBusiness cabin features include:

Privacy and elbow room along with a vacant middle seat
Complimentary in-flight meals
Enhanced baggage allowance of 35 kg
Complimentary food & beverage invitation for lounge/restaurant at select airports
Car transfers between the terminal and the aircraft at select airports
Priority check-in and disembarkation
Personalized on-board service

faqQuestion: What is Club Vistara ?
faqAnswer:
Club Vistara is a rewards program as unique as you. 

Your loyalty to Vistara is cherished and we want to ensure you get the best when you fly with us. Take your Vistara experience to newer heights with our frequent flyer program – the fastest rewarding program in the Indian sky.

Increased baggage allowance, priority boarding, lounge access and many more special benefits await you, including other perks that increase as you reach higher Club Vistara tiers.

You stop at nothing. So why should your frequent flyer program? Elevate your travel experience, join Club Vistara.

faqQuestion: Does Vistara provide discounts for Students ?
faqAnswer: At Vistara, we are delighted to offer Vistara Student Discount - an opportunity to get up to 10% off each time you choose to book an Economy Class flight with us via airvistara.com.

faqQuestion: How do I travel between terminals at Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi ?
faqAnswer: Inter terminal transfer coaches are provided which connect passengers between Terminal 3 and Terminal 1D . A Inter Terminal Transfer Helpdesk is located outside the arrival terminals for assistance.

faqQuestion: What should I expect at the Security Checkpoint?
faqAnswer: The Passenger Security Checkpoint includes three (3) primary steps.

faqQuestion: Where a person can get information for issue/conversion of a licence?
faqAnswer: The requirements for conversion/issue of licence are specified in CAR Section 7 Series ‘G’ Part I and schedule-II of the aircraft rules. The requirements for CPL are also clearly spelled out in the application form for issue / conversions of CPL.

faqQuestion: Whether a licence lapsed can be renewed?
faqAnswer: Expired license are renewed under Rule 42 of the Aircraft Rules. The requirements for renewal of expired licences/ ratings are laid down in CAR Section 7 Series ‘H’ Part I also.

faqQuestion: Whether fee will be adjusted in case documents are withdrawn due to some shortfall in papers?
faqAnswer: The requirement for fees for issue, renewal and validation of licences and ratings are specified in Rule 48 (1) of the Aircraft Rules. In case the documents are withdrawn due to some shortfall in the papers, the fee deposited can be adjusted at the time of issue, renewal and validation of licences/ratings subsequently.

faqQuestion: How much time is taken by DGCA to process the issue of licence?
faqAnswer: for issue of license, the entire documents are returned for necessary compliance and addition 15 days are required for reexamination of the documents form the date of submission of documents in DGCA.

faqQuestion: How to renew IR on CPL?
faqAnswer: India subject to compliance to the recency requirement as laid down in the operations circular 2 of 2004

faqQuestion: Whether any permission is required for carrying out instrument rating test outside India on Indian CPL?
faqAnswer: of the concerned ICAO contracting state.

faqQuestion: where an I get my license renewed?
faqAnswer: You can get renewed near the section of plaza

faqQuestion: Can a wheelchair be made available to me all the way to the aircraft?
faqAnswer: Yes. Passengers are requested to pre-book wheelchairs at the time of flight booking / ticket issuance to avoid last minute delays / non availability of wheelchairs. However, business class passengers should note that if traveling by the B747/COMBI/744 aircraft types, ascending/descending steps will be necessary. Hence, before making your reservation please check the type of aircraft with our reservations center. You should be able to ascend/descend the steps and walk to/from your seat.

faqQuestion: Can I carry my own electrically operated wheelchair with me on board the aircraft?
faqAnswer: Yes. However, a medical certificate stating the need to carry and operate your own wheelchair has to be produced.

faqQuestion: Till what stage can a pregnant woman travel without an escort?
faqAnswer: An expectant mother in good health may be accepted for transportation up to and including the 32nd week of pregnancy. At the time of making the bookings, if the pregnancy is advanced beyond 32 weeks and with the anticipation of normal delivery, the expectant mother be accepted for travel up to and including the 35th week of pregnancy, i.e., up to, at least 5 weeks prior to the expected date of confinement. A medical certificate from the attending obstetrician must be obtained stating that she is fit to travel.

faqQuestion: if l wish to carry my pet with me on board the aircraft, can I?
faqAnswer: Pet animals can be carried as an accompanied baggage or shipped as Cargo. You will have to make this request at the time of making your booking. The staff will advise you about certain formalities that you will have to complete. Pets will be carried at an additional charge and will not be included in the Free Baggage Allowance, even if the passenger has no other baggage. Normal Excess Baggage Charges would be applicable for carriage of accompanied pets on domestic journeys within India.

faqQuestion: Where are the Baby Care Rooms located at Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai ?
faqAnswer:
Baby Care Rooms are located at Terminal 1  and Terminal T2 of Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport (CSIA) Mumbai.
For details please visit - www.csia.in/atcsia/child-care-facility.aspx

faqQuestion: Is there any Child Care lounge facility at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad ?
faqAnswer: Separate Child Care Lounges are not available but Nappy change rooms are available at Departures and Arrivals of Indira Gandhi International Airport Delhi. The airport is working towards providing a Nursing room.

faqQuestion: Does Rajiv Gandhi International Airport Hyderabad have any medical facility ?
faqAnswer: The Medical Centre at Airport is facilitated by Apollo Medical Centre, equipped with a 24-hour pharmacy and well-trained doctors and paramedics available round the clock at RGIA, to serve as an emergency treatment centre for passengers/visitors who may develop medical complications while on travel or in the airport premises. The airport also has an Ambulance on standby to cater to any medical emergency. Apart from this APOLLO Pharmacy is available at Car Park Level, Domestic Security Hold area & International Security Hold area.

faqQuestion: Does Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport Kolkata have any medical facility ?
faqAnswer:
Round the clock Medical Facilities are available at Terminal -2 which are being managed by AAI and Medica Super Speciality Hospital. Medical Inspection room in Departure Level is being managed by AAI and they can be contacted at 251198017 /25691033.Medical Inspection room at Arrival Level is being managed by Medica Super Speciality Hospital and they can be contacted at 25691128 / 9903388004. In case of emergency, passengers can also contact Airport Manager for arranging Medical assistance.

The contact No.s are given below:
Terminal Manager (Departure)- 25118036 / 25691002
Terminal Manager (Arrival)- 25118038 / 25691003

faqQuestion: What special services does IndiGo Offer ?
faqAnswer:
IndiGo offers special services for Unaccompanied Minors, Infants and Wheelchair Customers. Such Customers are required to mention the requirement of these services at the time of making the booking. IndiGo reserves the right to deny these services to Customers if not requested in advance.
Any customer who require medical assistance or stretchers are required to complete the IndiGo Medical Information Form which can be found in the Information Centre.

faqQuestion: Can I carry my pet on board of IndiGo flights?
faqAnswer: IndiGo does not permit the carriage of pets or animals on its aircraft. Guide dogs for blind customers are exempt from this rule and must be booked via IndiGo Call Centre.

faqQuestion: Does SpiceJet allow me to bring my pets on board with me for International  travel?
faqAnswer: No. SpiceJet does not permit the carriage of pets on its international flights. Guide dogs for blind Customers are exempt from this rule, but any Customer traveling with a guide dog should make his/her reservation via the SpiceJet Reservations and provide us notice that a guide dog will be traveling. Please note that guide dogs for the blind may not occupy any seat. The Customer is required to bring a moisture absorbent mat, and to place it under the guide dog. Further, the guide dog should be properly trained, restrained and muzzled.

faqQuestion: Should I lock my Baggage?
faqAnswer: Yes. In case of the requirements of physical check on doubt, you will be requested to open the baggage yourself.

faqQuestion: Is there any Baggage Wrapping facility at Chennai International Airport ?
faqAnswer:
Baggage wrapping service using state of the art technology is available in the city side as well as the check in area of International Terminals.

Please Note: Currently INR 399/- per bag is being charged for baggage wrapping. Cash, Paytm, Debit card & Credit card are accepted.

faqQuestion: What are the baggage allowances for Jet Airways operated flights ?
faqAnswer:
Free Baggage Allowance depends on a variety of factors such as guest type (Adult / Child / Infant), class of booking, point of sale (country where ticket is purchased), point of origin (place of commencement of journey), booking period, routing and more. Free Baggage Allowance (FBA) displayed on the ticket/ booking will be considered as the FBA applicable for your journey. Guests are requested to kindly refer to their e-ticket / booking, to confirm the applicable free baggage allowance.

Please note that additional baggage allowance is not displayed on your ticket.

For our JetPrivilege Platinum / Gold / Silver members who are also co-brand credit card members, only the higher of the two allowances will apply.
For example: If a JetPrivilege Platinum member is also a co-brand credit card holder, the guest will be entitled to only 20 kgs of additional baggage allowance and not 30kgs, when travelling in Première within the Indian Subcontinent.

Effective Oct 4, 2016, JetPrivilege Silver, Gold & Platinum members will enjoy additional baggage allowance when flying with Etihad Airways Partner airlines. For details, click here.

In case separate tickets are issued for routes within India with international connections, the baggage allowance shown on the domestic ticket will apply to routes within India on Jet Airways flights.

For journeys between India and international destinations, where international flights have connections with Jet Airways flights operating within India, additional excess baggage rate of USD 6 per kg will apply. (Exception: This additional excess baggage rate of USD 6 per kg is not applicable on flights departing from Gulf / Middle East with connections on domestic India flights.)

All guests carrying check-in baggage or items exceeding the specified dimensions of 158 cms will be charged a fee of INR 1000 (service tax as applicable) at the airport counter. This fee will be charged in addition to the existing excess baggage fee wherever applicable. This fee is applicable to all guests travelling within India.
